BinTree
Class TreeCalculator

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--BinTree.TreeCalculator
public class TreeCalculator
extends java.lang.Object

TreeCalculator holds some basic methods for computing on BinaryTrees

Constructor Summary
TreeCalculator()
           
 
Method Summary
 int countNodes(BinaryTree t)
          countNodes returns the number of Node-objects within a tree
 BinaryTree insertToLeft(java.lang.Object v, BinaryTree t)
          insertToLeft adds an object as the leftmost node of an existing tree, that is, in the tree's ``leftmost lower corner''.
 BinaryTree insertToRight(java.lang.Object v, BinaryTree t)
          insertToRight adds an object as the rightmost node of an existing tree, that is, in the tree's ``rightmost lower corner''.
 void printContents(BinaryTree t)
          printContents prints all the values held within a binary tree; the tree is traversed left-to-right pre-order (value printed first), formatted and labelled so that you can see the tree's structure
 void printInOrder(BinaryTree t)
          printInOrder prints all the values held within a binary tree; the tree is traversed left-to-right _in-order_ (value printed in middle)
 void printPreOrder(BinaryTree t)
          printPreOrder prints all the values held within a binary tree; the tree is traversed left-to-right _pre-order_ (value printed first)

Method Detail

countNodes

public int countNodes(BinaryTree t)
countNodes returns the number of Node-objects within a tree
Parameters:
t - - the tree analyzed
Returns:
the number of Nodes within t

printPreOrder

public void printPreOrder(BinaryTree t)
printPreOrder prints all the values held within a binary tree; the tree is traversed left-to-right _pre-order_ (value printed first)
Parameters:
t - - the tree traversed and printed

printInOrder

public void printInOrder(BinaryTree t)
printInOrder prints all the values held within a binary tree; the tree is traversed left-to-right _in-order_ (value printed in middle)
Parameters:
t - - the tree traversed and printed

printContents

public void printContents(BinaryTree t)
printContents prints all the values held within a binary tree; the tree is traversed left-to-right pre-order (value printed first), formatted and labelled so that you can see the tree's structure

insertToRight

public BinaryTree insertToRight(java.lang.Object v,
                                BinaryTree t)
insertToRight adds an object as the rightmost node of an existing tree, that is, in the tree's ``rightmost lower corner''.
Parameters:
v - - the object to be inserted
t - - the existing tree
Returns:
a newly constructed tree (which shares most of t!) that looks just like t except it holds v as its rightmost Node.

insertToLeft

public BinaryTree insertToLeft(java.lang.Object v,
                               BinaryTree t)
insertToLeft adds an object as the leftmost node of an existing tree, that is, in the tree's ``leftmost lower corner''.
Parameters:
v - - the object to be inserted
t - - the existing tree
Returns:
a newly constructed tree (which shares most of t!) that looks just like t except it holds v as its leftmost Node.
